messages.subject: Little House on the Prarie
messages.msgSnippet: Reading the news this morning there is a Little House on the Prarie reference in a very British article:
messages.messageBody:
Reading the news this morning there is a Little House on the Prarie reference in a very British article: http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/tennis/wimbledon/5733621/Wimbledon-2009-Andy-Roddick-defeats-Andy-Murray-to-set-up-Roger-Federer-clash.html

"Murray occasionally biffed and bashed his hand against his strings when events turned against him. Nothing much worked out for him on his first appearance in a Wimbledon semi-final – he was falsely accused of swearing by the umpire, and received a warning for “an audible obscenity”, even though the 22 year-old’s language was as clean as the dialogue from Little House on the Prairie.
"

It would suggest that at least the Michael Landon version of the midwest has made his mark on the British reference base.

Schuyler


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
